snippet: Sami Shah, who was making a name for himself as a comedian in Pakistan, left with his family for Australia not just because of death threats but because of his daughter’s birth.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Sami Shah, Pakistan-born comedian who is creating new life and new audience for his political brand of humor in Australia; Shah's routine earned him death threats as well as appreciation in his home country, but he says he did not consider leaving until the birth of his daughter.
lead_paragraph: Sami Shah, who was making a name for himself as a comedian in Pakistan, left with his family for Australia not just because of death threats but because of his daughter’s birth.

headline.main: Comic Finds New Life, and Punch Lines, in Australia
headline.print_headline: Comic Finds New Life, and Punch Lines, in Australia
